title: Designates first two days of Passover and Good Friday as school holidays in New York city
summary: Provides that the board of education for the city of New York shall designate the first two days of Passover and Good Friday as school holidays.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2232

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the education law, in relation to providing that the first
two days of Passover and Good Friday be designated school holidays

SUMMARY:
This bill amends section 2554 to the
Education  Law by adding a new
subdivision 28 to provide that a special provision be made, in the
City of New York,
for the first two days of Passover and be designated as school
holidays.

Law by adding be made, in the Good Friday to

JUSTIFICATION:
This bill would give those students and faculty the
chance to observe Passover and Good Friday without being adversely
affected by missing school days. There is also a practical
consideration since the school system would stand to lose significant
state financial remuneration because of the extensive absenteeism
that would Occur on those days. This bill would also ensure that the
school systems' instructive value Would not be curtailed due to
faculty absenteeism.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
